title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former Patriots and Colts kicker, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with the Patriots and scored game-winning field goals in critical moments.
Vinatieri holds the NFL records for most career points (2,673) and consecutive field goals (44).

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel simulated a longer halftime during practice to prepare for Super Bowl LX.
Quarterback Drake Maye fully participated despite a shoulder issue; edge rusher Harold Landry III was limited.
Bad Bunny will perform at the halftime show; rumors suggest Cardi B may join as a guest performer.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: The Patriots face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX with quarterbacks Drake Maye and Sam Darnold leading their teams.
Both teams are evenly matched, with the Patriots and Seahawks ranking high in points scored and defense allowed.
Key defensive players like Milton Williams may play crucial roles in limiting the opposing quarterbacks' mistakes.

title: Mass. company pleads guilty to OSHA violation that led to employee’s death
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: John Oliveira & Sons Stamp Concrete, Inc. pleaded guilty to OSHA violations in an accident that killed employee Josué Tiquiram in 2023.
The accident occurred when a malfunctioning tail conveyor at an East Freetown worksite crushed Tiquiram's head, leading to his death.
The guilty plea subjects the company to up to five years of probation, a $500,000 fine, and restitution; sentencing is in May.

title: Here’s what Healey put up in her Super Bowl bet with Washington state governor
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey wagered Dunkin' coffee, clam chowder, and lobster rolls with Washington Gov. Bob Ferguson over the Super Bowl.
If the Patriots win, Washington Gov. Ferguson will send Healey local shellfish and coffee as part of their bet.
Gov. Healey is attending the Super Bowl in Santa Clara to support the Patriots and promote Massachusetts tourism and economy.

title: Woman convicted of fraud after living under a stolen identity for more than 20 years
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Lina Maria Orovio-Hernandez, 59, was convicted in Boston for identity theft and voter fraud using a stolen identity.
She fraudulently received around $400,000 in federal benefits, including Section 8 assistance and Social Security payments.
Orovio-Hernandez faces deportation after serving potential prison sentences for charges carrying up to 10 years in prison.

title: Celtics rally from 22 down in Vucevic’s debut to beat Heat: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics defeated Miami Heat 98-96 after erasing a 22-point deficit at TD Garden.
Nikola Vucevic made his debut, contributing 11 points and 12 rebounds in 28 minutes for the Celtics.
Payton Pritchard sparked a third-quarter rally with 19 points, including a key 3-pointer over Norman Powell.

title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially stated he wasn't supporting the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, citing no attachment to either team.
Days before the game, Brady showed support for owner Robert Kraft, urging the Patriots to win their seventh ring.
Some former teammates, including Vince Wilfork and Robert Spillane, criticized Brady for his initial neutral stance.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Matthew Stafford edged out Drake Maye for the 2025-26 NFL MVP by six points.
Jeff Saturday and Mina Kimes argued Maye's dual-threat skills and fewer resources made him more deserving.
Drake Maye had higher QBR and first down stats against common opponents compared to Stafford.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Darnold's performance under pressure from the Patriots' defense is crucial for the Super Bowl outcome.
Seattle ranks 29th in yards per rush allowed to quarterbacks, potentially aiding Patriots' QB Drake Maye's ground game.
Patriots' LB Robert Spillane's ankle injury may affect their run defense against Seattle's Kenneth Walker.
